pullRequest.body:
In this PR we define the associated graded structure for abelian group when given a filtration and only give some basic lemmas about it.
Further results would be given in #20913

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b89e713b0b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22631/commits/b89e713b0b4dec570b4bfd0e6dfcb7190e560e2b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.FilteredAlgebra.AssociatedGraded` (new file)|693|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AssociatedGraded`
`+ GradedPiece`
`+ HEq_eq_mk_coe_eq`
`+ HEq_eq_mk_eq`
`+ HEq_rfl`
`+ ext`
`+ induction_on`
`+ instance [Preorder ι] [IsFiltration F F_lt] (i : ι) : Setoid (AddSubgroup.ofClass (F i))`
`+ mk_apply_of_mem`
`+ mk_apply_of_not_mem`
`+ mk_eq`
`+ mk_injective`
`+ of`
`+ of_apply`
`+ of_eq_of_ne`
`+ of_injective`
`+ sum_support_of`
`+ sum_univ_of`
`+ support_of`
`+ support_of_subset`
`++ mk`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Isn't this dangerous? Maybe it isn't. Are there any instances in mathlib which put decidable equality on a quotient? For example equality is decidable on the integers, and membership of `\bot : Ideal \Z` might also be decidable (is it?), and then membership of the quotient `\Z / \bot` would be decidable, and now you have a diamond if you put e.g. the filtration on \Z which just jumps from \bot to \top at some point (and this kind of filtration is certainly a thing mathematically). Does our setup force you to remove this instance and just put ugly and mathematically-irrelevant decidability hypotheses here there and everywhere?
Decidability of equality of this quotient amounts to decidable membership of `F_lt`, I think?
I think I should remove this thing and add the correct ones here to there. sorry
As you're defining `mk ` as an `abbrev`, I'd argue you don't need any of these lemmas.
Are there `DirectSum` versions of these lemmas? If so, you should be using them instead of the `DFinsupp` versions.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra): define associated graded structure for abelian group

source.title: feat(Algebra): Define the associated graded ring to filtered ring.
